titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that Lionel Hampton should be honored for his contributions to American music.
Expressing the sense of Congress that Lionel Hampton should be honored for his contributions to American music.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.
Mr. Castle moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 63.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

committee.name: House Education and the Workforce
committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of Congress that Lionel Hampton should be honored for his contributions to American music and for his work as an ambassador of goodwill and democracy.
